definition: continuous/unceasing
surname Lian
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
to continue/to replenish
(negative prefix)/not/no
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: A time of continual change is taking place within, and around, the manufactured fiber industry.
sentences.chinese: 化學纖維工業正在發生連續不斷的變化。

sentences.english: It moves in a succession to which the nations are subsidiary.
sentences.chinese: 世界史連續不斷地朝請民族均附屬於它的方向發展。

sentences.english: We need not tell you that continuity of offers is very important.
sentences.chinese: 報盤的連續不斷非常重要，自不待言。

sentences.english: Glamour rating? It's all about the caked on eyeliner and chain-smoked cigarettes here.
sentences.chinese: 魅力指數？全都是結塊的眼線妝和連續不斷的香菸。

sentences.english: The ranks of our army beat on the enemy's forces.
sentences.chinese: 我們軍隊連續不斷地攻擊敵人。

sentences.english: Little episodes such as these continued throughout Robert's life.
sentences.chinese: 諸如此類的小事兒，在羅伯特的一生中連續不斷。

sentences.english: It's all about the caked on eyeliner and chain-smoked cigarettes here.
sentences.chinese: 全都是結塊的眼線妝和連續不斷的香菸。

sentences.english: I've been working more than ten hours without a letup.
sentences.chinese: 我連續不斷地工作了十多個小時了。

sentences.english: When approaching, the forelegs form a continuation of the straight line of the front.
sentences.chinese: 當前進時，前腿形成了一個連續不斷的直線。

sentences.english: Tuesday was a day of similar unremitting toil.
sentences.chinese: 星期二是同樣的連續不斷的苦工。

sentences.english: The loudspeakers poured forth a continuous programme of martial music.
sentences.chinese: 揚聲器連續不斷地放送軍樂節目。

sentences.english: He then kept receiving other pornographic messages, all from different numbers.
sentences.chinese: 隨後他就連續不斷地收到來自不同號碼的黃色信息。

sentences.english: If drums beat, they make a regular continuous sound.
sentences.chinese: 擊鼓時，鼓可以發出連續不斷的聲音。

sentences.english: No foreshock emerged before the earthquake, and its aftershock kept up for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 此次地震沒有明顯的前震，並且餘震連續不斷地發生。

sentences.english: Lying in my room for days on end.
sentences.chinese: 在於我的房間數天連續不斷。

sentences.english: We were sickened by the non-stopping noise.
sentences.chinese: 連續不斷的噪音使我們感到厭惡。

definition: deformation/bending
rigid body
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
unpredictable/changeable
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
to have no sense of shame/brazen
octagon
sequel/continuation of a book
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: warp/line of longitude/meridian (geography)
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
dejected/despondent/depressed
lit. like a sheet of loose sand/fig. unable to cooperate (idiom)
